events.name: HackerNest Singapore April Tech Social
events.description:
The long-and-short: Tech Socials are powered by awesome volunteer organizers that are passionate about community-building. 
Easy as pie. And, our whole team is involved in making sure you start with a blast and make awesome stuff happen! Please read the FAQ on our continually broken/changing site and GET IN TOUCH if you or someone you know might be interested. 
--------> 
Drinks on us. That's right: free beer/(possibly wine)/water. 
 
HackerNest Tech Socials are a fun, relaxed way to connect with your local tech brethren. Atmosphere: chill, friendly, unpretentious, agenda-free (no sales pitch, yo), and brimming with UltraSmart(TM) people. 
We believe that strong, supportive tech communities should exist everywhere - not just in hotspots like San Francisco and New York. In 2011, we started running Tech Socials in Toronto, where our monthly attendance grew to over 350+ technologists literally 100% from word-of-mouth. 
The typical Tech Social schedule: 
- 6:30pm: folks arrive, grab drinks, socialize   - 7:00pm: quick intro, thank sponsors, quick announcements   - 7:10pm: back to chatting with interesting new friends   - 9:00pm: go home exhausted from great conversations 
Sponsors make this growing movement possible - email us to chat! 
Venue: 
Zopim: Talk to your customers in real time 
 
Wanna show off your office? We're always looking for big open spaces with 50+ (standing room) capacity that are easily accessible. 
About Us: 
HackerNest is an international nonprofit uniting local tech communities through unpretentious Tech Socials and hackathons. We cram lots of smart, accomplished people into a room with free drinks. Our relaxed, down-to-earth events attract a diverse and highly technical membership. Strict no-douchebag policy.
events.location: Zopim, , 401 Commonwealth Drive, Haw Par Technocentre, #07-01, 149598, Singapore null

events.name: Creative Coding Meetup — Three of Pentacles
events.description: For this instalment of Creative Coding Meetup, we have three presenters lined up, namely George Gally, Daniel Wessolek and Cedric Honnet. Staying true to the amorphic definition of “creative coding”, our presenters will be span the spectrum of topics. George Gally http://radarboy.com/george/ is [ironcially] a coding denier/artist, and is enthusiastic about a wide range of artistics expressions dominated by technology and real world analogue interactions. George will be touching upon the topic of motion and audio reactive in Javascript. Daniel Wessolek http://danielwessolek.com/port/ works as a research associate in Interaction Design at Bauhaus University Weimar. His research currently focuses on glowing matter, open design and civil engagement. Cedric Honnet http://www.hackster.io/cedric spent most of his life tinkering with music and computers. He studied engineering but kept exploring arts and interactivity. Cedric will share some of the tricks he discovered while collaborating with artists in France, Colombia, California and in Singapore. Venue: The Growell Pop Up https://www.facebook.com/thegrowellpopup 107-109 Rowell Road Time: Talks start at 7:30pm, but do feel free to drop by early to take a tour around the space and find out what the urban farmers are up to. Refreshments: Kindly sponsored by Zopim https://www.zopim.com/
events.location: The Growell Pop Up, 107/109 Rowell Road, Singapore

events.name: Papers We Love SG #008
events.description: Paper #1 - "An Industrial-Strength Audio Search Algorithm" - Avery Li-Chun Wang : Chinmay Pendharkar Paper #2 - "Typeclassopedia" - Brent Yorgey : Timothy Kevin Oxley ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

events.name: Coding Dojo Continued
events.description: New Dojo, same problem. https://github.com/SingaporeScalaProgrammers/gokata Hopefully this time we will get on to the juicy bits towards the end. Don't worry if you weren't at the last dojo, there will be plenty of people who are starting from scratch as well. Looking forward to seeing everyone there.
events.location: ThoughtWorks office, 87B Amoy Street, Level 3, Singapore
